title.narrative: GENDER SENSITIVE INFORMATION SYSTEMS

description.narrative: Gender sensitive Information, Management & Performance Monitoring and National Reporting Systems are in place., which contributes to Building Capacity For Evaluation, Cross-Sectoral Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Cross-Sectoral Planning And Programme Reviews, Gender Discriminatory Roles And Practices, Social Exclusion â€“ Data And Evidence, Unicef Capacity For Programming On Gender. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Evidence and coordination enables government, communities and partners to improve capacity and systems for equity-focused funding, advocacy , policies & legislation, strategies, planning & supply chain management to scale up results for children.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Gender sensitive Information, Management & Performance Monitoring and National Reporting Systems are in place.

description.narrative: Information Management Systems (Etools, Emergency Dashboard Alert System, SudanInfo Dashboard and mobile phone app for SDG monitoring) developed and rolled out for managing results for children, while national GIS capacity has been enhanced. Humanitarian Performance Monitoring indicators have served to measure results achieved through NGO partnerships. | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:16/01/2018

actual.value: 2017:Partnership module of Etools has been fully rolled out, but trip management module will only be rolled out in 2018

actual.value: 2017:Sudan Info database updated and linked with interactive dashboard and mobile app
